Malden.Great Chelsea fire of 1908: The Great Chelsea fire of 1908, also known as the First great Chelsea fire, was a conflagration that occurred on 12 April 1908, in Chelsea, Massachusetts. Nineteen people were killed, fifteen thousand people were left homeless, and 350 acres (140 ha) were burned in the fire. The fire started two hundred yards away from the Great Chelsea fire of 1973.
